turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Remember (Walking in the Sand).
turn.2: In order to fit the AM radio format of the time, the song had to be cut in length, but rather than edit it, Morton simply faded it out after 2:10.
turn.3: What are some other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: In another version Morton presents the demo to various Red Bird staffers, Jeff Barry, Ellie Greenwich, Artie Butler and others and they and some session musicians (including drummer Gary Chester) took the demo into the studio where it became, "a whole other record." The song was released as the debut single by The Shangri-Las on Red Bird Records and became a number five hit on the "Billboard" Hot 100, and number nine on the "Cashbox" R&B chart.
turn.6: It also hit number fourteen on the UK Singles Chart, and became more successful in the UK when reissued on several occasions in the 1970s.
turn.7: Who else was featured on the song?
turn.8: As noted above, Billy Joel, an unknown working as a session musician at the time, played piano on the original demo recording of the song and has playfully claimed that Morton failed to pay him his $67 union scale fee for the performance.
turn.9: What other awards did the song win?
turn.10: The Shangri-Las' recording placed #395 on "Rolling Stone"s 500 Greatest Songs of All Time list in 2004. " Billboard" named the song #26 on their list of 100 Greatest Girl Group Songs of All Time.
turn.11: Was it a hit on the charts?
turn.12: In the early 1970s, Buddah Records released a "Radio Active Gold" oldies 45 containing an undubbed version of the demo (no echo or sound effects).
